metadata.name: AWS ECS Task Definition That Queries The Credential Endpoint
metadata.comment: Detects when an Elastic Container Service (ECS) Task Definition includes a command to query the credential endpoint. This can indicate a potential adversary adding a backdoor to establish persistence or escalate privileges.

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM api_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (lower(metadata.product.name) = lower('ecs.amazonaws.com') AND (lower(LOWER(api.operation)) in ('describetaskdefinition', 'registertaskdefinition', 'runtask')) AND contains(lower(api.request.data), lower('$aws_container_credentials_relative_uri')))

output.summary: Detects when an Elastic Container Service (ECS) Task Definition includes a command to query the credential endpoint. This can indicate a potential adversary adding a backdoor to establish persistence or escalate privileges.

metadata.objective: False positive: Task Definition being modified to request credentials from the Task Metadata Service for valid reasons References: https://github.com/RhinoSecurityLabs/pacu/blob/866376cd711666c775bbfcde0524c817f2c5b181/pacu/modules/ecs__backdoor_task_def/main.py, https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonECS/latest/APIReference/API_RegisterTaskDefinition.html, https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonECS/latest/developerguide/task-iam-roles.html
